intro: Scorzonera chantavica, commonly known as the Persian scorzonera, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountains of Central Asia. It features a robust, tuberous root system that is often harvested for its edible qualities. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are yellow, with five petals, and appear in clusters at the top of the plant. Scorzonera chantavica thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
